com.sri.ai.grinder.polynomial.api

Interface Monomial

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>, Expression, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultMonomial

    @Beta
public interface Monomial
extends Expression
    A monomial is a product of factors, where the numeric factor (if any) is the first argument and the non-numeric factors are in order.
    Examples: 
     
 3*x^2
 y
 y^2
 10
 4*x^3*y^2
 150*x^2
    Author:
    oreilly

    • Method Detail

      • getNumericFactor

        Rational getNumericFactor()
        Returns:
        the numeric factor of the monomial (if not explicitly defined is 1).

      • isNumericConstant

        default boolean isNumericConstant()
        Returns:
        true if this monomial is equivalent to a numeric constant;

      • isZero

        default boolean isZero()
        Returns:
        true if this monomial is equivalent to the numeric constant zero.

      • isOne

        default boolean isOne()
        Returns:
        true if this monomial is equivalent to the numeric constant one.

      • getFactors

        java.util.Set<Expression> getFactors()
        The factors of a monomial M is the Collection factors(M). They are the expressions being multiplied, and possibly exponentiated by non-negative integers. Example: 
         
 factors(10 * |Dogs|^2 * |People|^3 * f(y) * (x + 2) * x^2) = { 10, |Dogs|, |People|, f(y), x + 2, x }
        Returns:
        a Set representation of the factors contained within the Monomial (this includes the numeric factor).

      • getOrderedNonNumericFactors

        java.util.List<Expression> getOrderedNonNumericFactors()
        Get a unique list, ordered, of the non-numeric factors in the monomial.
        Returns:
        an ordered list of the non-numeric factors contained in the monomial.

      • getPowersOfNonNumericFactors

        java.util.List<Rational> getPowersOfNonNumericFactors()
        Returns:
        the powers of the non-numeric factors in the monomial, which map to the order of these factors.

      • getCoefficient

        Monomial getCoefficient(java.util.List<Expression> factors)
        The coefficient of a monomial M wrt a set of factors F is the product of the remaining factors of M. Example: 
         
 coefficient(3*x^2*y^4, { x }) = 3* y^4
        Parameters:
        factors - what are to be considered the factors of the monomial (i.e. not part of the coefficient).
        Returns:
        the product of the remaining factors in this monomial not in the given list of factors.

      • getPowerOfFactor

        Rational getPowerOfFactor(Expression factor)
        Get the power of the given factor if it is a factor of the monomial otherwise return 0.
        Parameters:
        factor - the factor whose power is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the power of the given factor if the factor is contained in the monomial. If not contained in the monomial will return 0.

      • getSignature

        default java.util.List<Rational> getSignature(java.util.List<Expression> factors)
        The signature of a monomial M wrt a tuple of factors F is the tuple of the powers of the factors in F in M (the power is 0 if the factor is not present in M).
        Examples:
         
 signature(3 * y * x^2,  (x, y, z))            =  (2, 1, 0)
 signature(3,            (x, y, z))            =  (0, 0, 0)
 signature(3 * (x + 2),  (x + 2, x, y, z))     =  (1, 0, 0, 0)
 signature(3 * (x + 2),  (3, x + 2, x, y, z))  =  (1, 1, 0, 0, 0)
        Parameters:
        factors - a list of factors.
        Returns:
        the tuple of the powers of the given factors that are in this Monomial (0 is returned for the power of factors not present in this monomial).

      • getSignature

        default java.util.List<Rational> getSignature()
        Convenience method that gets the signature of this Monomial using the non-numeric factors contained within.
        Returns:
        the tuple of the powers of the non-numeric factors that are in this Monomial.

      • areLikeTerms

        default boolean areLikeTerms(Monomial other,
                             java.util.List<Expression> factors)
        Two monomials M1 and M2 are like terms wrt a tuple of factors F if signature(M1, F) = signature(M2, F).
        Examples: 
         
 x^2 * y  and 3 * y * x^2 wrt F = (x, y)
 x^2 * y  and 3 * y * x^2 wrt F = (x)
 x^2 * y  and 3 * y * x^2 wrt F = (y)
 x^2 * y  and 3 * y * x^2 wrt F = ()
 x and 3 * x wrt F = (x)
 10 and 20 wrt F = ()
        Parameters:
        monomial - the monomial to check if a like term to this monomial.
        factors - the factors to construct the signature used to determine if two monomials are like terms.
        Returns:
        true if are like terms based on the given factors, false otherwise.

      • areLikeTerms

        default boolean areLikeTerms(Monomial other)
        Convenience method that uses the ordered union of non-numeric factors from this and the other Monomial to provide the second argument to areLikeTerms(Monomial, List).
        Parameters:
        other - the monomial to check if a like term to this monomial.
        Returns:
        true if are like terms based on the combined non-numeric factors, false otherwise.

      • degree

        int degree()
        The degree of a monomial is the sum of the exponents of all its non-numeric factors (numeric factors have a degree of 0).
        Returns:
        the degree of the monomial.

      • negate

        Monomial negate()
        Negate the multinomial.
        Returns:
        a new Monomial representing the negation of this monomial.

      • times

        Monomial times(Monomial multiplier)
        Multiply this Monomial by another.
        Parameters:
        multiplier - the multiplier.
        Returns:
        a new Monomial representing the result of the multiplication.

      • divide

        Pair<Monomial,Monomial> divide(Monomial divisor)
        Divide this monomial by another. 
         
 this.divide(that) = this/that
        Parameters:
        divisor - the divisor
        Returns:
        a pair consisting of the quotient and remainder of this/divisor.

      • exponentiate

        Monomial exponentiate(int exponent)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Raise this monomial to a given power.
        Parameters:
        exponent - a non negative integer exponent to raise the monomial to.
        Returns:
        a monomial which is the result of raising this monomial to the given exponent.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the exponent is negative.

      • orderedUnionOfNonNumericFactors

        static java.util.List<Expression> orderedUnionOfNonNumericFactors(Monomial m1,
                                                                  Monomial m2)
        Create an ordered union (no duplicates) of the non-numeric factors contained in two Monomials.
        Parameters:
        m1 - the first monomial.
        m2 - the second monomial.
        Returns:
        the ordered union (no duplicates) of the non-numeric factors contained in two Monomials.
